description: From Middle English halsnen; equivalent to halse (“to salute, beseech”) +‎ -en. Related to Middle High German heilsen (“to predict”); more at halse.

verbs.description: halsen (third-person singular simple present halsens, present participle halsening, simple past and past participle halsened)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To promise; bode; bid (fair or ill).
